text.section:
In this section, "public entity" means:
a political subdivision of the State;
a unit of the State or a local government; or
a nonprofit or nonstock corporation that:
receives 50% or more of its annual operating budget from the State or a local government; and
is exempt from taxation under § 501(c)(3) or (4) of the Internal Revenue Code.
Public entities may pool together to purchase casualty insurance, property insurance, or health insurance or to self-insure against casualty, property, or health risks.
